Q_STUDY_TITLE.label: study_title
Q_STUDY_TITLE.description: Short description that will identify the dataset on public pages. A clear and concise formula for the title would be like: {methodology} of {organism}: {sample info} e.g. RNA-Seq of mus musculus: adult female spleen

Q_STUDY_TYPE.label: study_type
Q_STUDY_TYPE.description: Type of the study in a controlled vocabulary

Q_STUDY_ABSTRACT.label: study_abstract
Q_STUDY_ABSTRACT.description: Abstract of a study as it could appear in a publication

Q_PUBMEDIDS.label: pubMedIds
Q_PUBMEDIDS.description: PUBMED IDs of papers published for the project

Q_REGION.label: region
Q_REGION.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (v 1.512) (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)

Q_SUBJECT_ID.label: subject_id
Q_SUBJECT_ID.description: Organism group: identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained

Q_PHENOTYPE.label: phenotype
Q_PHENOTYPE.description: Experimental Ontology Factor accession for phenotype

Q_SAMPLE_AGE.label: sample_age
Q_SAMPLE_AGE.description: age at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

Q_DESCRIPTION.label: description
Q_DESCRIPTION.description: Sample type, such as cell culture, mixed culture, tissue sample, whole organism, single cell, metagenomic assembly

Q_TAXON_ID.label: taxon_id
Q_TAXON_ID.description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if possible). It is OK to submit an organism name that is not in our database. In the case of a new species, provide the desired organism name, and our taxonomists may assign a provisional taxID. In the case of unidentified species, choose the appropriate Genus and include 'sp.', e.g.,
. When sequencing a genome from a non-metagenomic source, include a strain or isolate name too, e.g.,
. For more information about providing a valid organism, including new species, metagenomes (microbiomes) and metagenome-assembled genomes, see https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/docs/organism/.

Q_ORGANISM_PART.label: organism_part
Q_ORGANISM_PART.description: Type of tissue the sample was taken from.

Q_LIBRARY_STRATEGY.label: library_strategy
Q_LIBRARY_STRATEGY.description: Controlled vocabulary of terms describing overall strategy of the library. Terms used by TCGA include {WGS, WXS*, RNA-Seq*}

Q_LIBRARY_SOURCE.label: library_source
Q_LIBRARY_SOURCE.description: Controlled vocabulary of terms describing starting material from the sample. Terms used by TCGA include {GENOMIC, TRANSCRIPTOMIC*}

Q_LIBRARY_SELECTION.label: library_selection
Q_LIBRARY_SELECTION.description: Controlled vocabulary of terms describing selection or reduction method use in library construction. Terms used by TCGA include {Random, Hybrid Selection}

Q_LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL.label: library_construction_protocol
Q_LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL.description: Protocol by which the library was created

Q_PLATFORM.label: platform
Q_PLATFORM.description: Controlled vocabulary of platform type {Illumina, LS454, AB_SOLID, CompleteGenomics}

Q_INSTRUMENT_MODEL.label: instrument_model
Q_INSTRUMENT_MODEL.description: Controlled vocabulary of instrument models {Illumina Genome Analyzer II, etc}

Q_DESIGN_DESCRIPTION.label: design_description
Q_DESIGN_DESCRIPTION.description: Free-form description of the methods used to create the sequencing library; a brief 'materials and methods' section.

Q_PAIRED_NOMINAL_LENGTH.label: paired_nominal_length
Q_PAIRED_NOMINAL_LENGTH.description: Average distance between the paired reads in a base pair

Q_PAIRED_NOMINAL_SDEV.label: paired_nominal_sdev
Q_PAIRED_NOMINAL_SDEV.description: standard deviation of distance between the paired reads in a base pair

Q_CHECKSUM_METHOD.label: checksum_method
Q_CHECKSUM_METHOD.description: Used checksum method to encrypt the file to be uploaded
